Little is remembered about Heinrich Strauss, a member of the leftist Berit Shalom Party, with its decidedly culturalist bent. His insightful “Jewish Art as a Minority Problem

147–171, was contrary to the national art paradigm regnant in early Israeli scholarship on Jewish art, and exemplified in the tradition of Sukenik as well as of Mordecai Narkiss and his son, Bezalel Narkiss.
